item.title: Invidious embed instead of Youtube's
item.description: When I thought about writing my blog post titled To Zinda Ho Tum, I was dilemma. Situation being, I couldn’t simply copy the poem in my blog. A simple attribution wouldn’t be enough. Then I remembered about Farhan Akhar’s narration of the poem for the movie ZKMD. I thought about embedding this video along with my thoughts on it. Now another dilemma arouse as YouTube even in it’s “Privacy-Enhanced mode” embed states: > When you turn on privacy-enhanced mode, YouTube won’t store information about visitors on your website unless they play the video.

item.title: Firefox Monitor
item.description: I have always preferred Firefox due to their approach to privacy as well as providing a viable alternative to Google backed Chromium/Chrome. Recently I also started using Thunderbird for Gmail (slowly trying to switch to ProtonMail). I couldn’t figure out why Gmail on Firefox for Linux with my extensions make the Gmail web client crawl. Coming to Firefox Monitor. It’s an online service to see if an account has been part of any public data breach.

item.title: Duckduckgo bangs!
item.description: Apart from privacy centric, non-profiled search results; bangs are one of the more underrated features offered by Duckduckgo (now also available on duck.com). Bangs are shortcuts that take you to search results on other sites. Right now there’re more than 13,500 bangs available. Syntax for bang - !bang SEARCH-TERM Example - !w Linux , it will get you to Wikipedia’s Linux entry. Note - Examples here assume that you’re on Duckduckgo or have it as default search engine.
